Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LRdFd5xY9SErecF0_V2aQw.text: Very expensive, but well worth it.  They know their meat and they do it right.  I had the filet mignon and it was perfection.  Additional praise to the servers, who were very welcoming and attentive.  Thank you.

lniED3WPK2ci-aDwyXceqg.text: When I say worth EVERY penny I mean it! Steak was cooked perfectly and Salmon was delicious! Don't let the prices scare you it is worth every dime you spend. Always my go to when I want to have that nice succulent experience. If you are considering it go fine with Ild Homestead!

fpTp-C0gT4oALet_okSbzw.text: Everyone is looking for a genuine experience nowadays. This place just goes to show how the hospitality industry had completely lost sight of what matters (and why Caesar's has filed bankruptcy twice - the standards are less than ideal). Your first impression is the decor and -- you guessed it - the front of the house. I was dismissed and treated with complete disregard by Daisy when asked to be seated for drinks and a modest dinner in a very empty restaurant. Her lack of friendliness and attentiveness completely left a bad taste in my mouth. I was in a convention all day and wanted a quick bite yet I wasn't able to sit in the totally dead restaurant. Its a testament to why restaurants need to value customers and stop acting entitled and Daisy? Should be fired, totally unprofessional and unaware of what service means.

1AqSlSo18_efP4H3MVQcAg.text: My husband and I came here for dinner on Monday night at 9:20pm, which was 10 minutes before their last seating. Our server, Nigel was very welcoming and did not seem to mind.   - We started with the Osetra caviar and wow! The 1oz jar came out in an ice sculpture complete with sides. It was delicious with a very impressive presentation.   -My husband had the Japanese Wagyu steak and it was the best we've ever had! It melted in our mouths. I believe it came with potatoes and mushrooms. He also got a side of asparagus which we enjoyed.   -I got the surf and turf with an 8oz filet and lobster tail. The lobster was delicious and my filet was cooked perfectly. I also ordered the lobster Mac and cheese and it was my least favorite thing that we ordered. It wasn't bad, it's just my personal taste that I don't enjoy super thick cheese, but I know many people do.   From start to finish (hostesses to everyone who came to our table) it was a very pleasant dining experience. Oh and we were able to charge the dinner to our room since we were staying at Caesars.   Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caviar presented in an ice sculpture!

jpeklcr7MxCwDLY-rNvyFg.text: The reviews are real. Dropped the ball completely. Oysters and bacon appetizer was great. Everything went downhill fast at dinner. Steak and foie gras over cooked. "Lobster mac" had no lobster and cream spinach was watery and way under seasoned. For a New Yorker this meal was a huge dissapointment. Ended up Double Eagle.

-3VCKOYSBXdvazKHTnpvPA.text: I have heard great things about this steakhouse but never had the chance to eat here until last night. It is located in Caesars Palace and has easy access from the self parking. The atmosphere is very relaxed and classy. We sat at the bar before dinner and the bartender was very helpful and friendly. He made me a perfect vodka martini so good I had to have two.  We were seated quickly and the server greeted us right away. He was very attentive through the meal all of his suggestions were on point. We started with the  roasted onion soup and the Yellowfin tuna  sashimi both were great. We then had the Filet Mignon for two perfectly prepared. We paired the meal with a nice bottle on Silver Oak Cab. and finished the meal with their world famous cheesecake! I will definitely make this a regular stop when I am on the strip. With all the steakhouses in Vegas this one is worth trying out.

0FD6MXxJY_Pa65q14-jimg.text: Favorite steakhouse.  We have tried many steakhouses and this has to be the best I've had.  The steaks are always cooked perfectly and the sides are amazing.  My favorite side is the mac and cheese.  This is my go to restaurant every time I'm in Vegas. I always try a new restaurant at least one of the nights but always enjoy Old Homestead the most.

V9vYYj52Cb3KR3s0zt9vXg.text: This restaurant has an inviting, warm interior. You are given a nice selection of bread rolls to start. We ordered the jumbo shrimp cocktail as an appetizer and it was delicious! The shrimp were huge and the cocktail sauce was perfect. My husband and I shared the 16 oz ribeye along with the Yukon mashed potatoes and bacon creamed spinach. The steak was perfectly cooked and extremely tender. The mashed potatoes were creamy and delicious. Creamed spinach is one of my favorite things to eat at a steakhouse and this one didn't disappoint. Our server, Joe, was attentive and continuously checked in on us to be sure we didn't need anything. We ordered the creme brulee for dessert and it was served with fresh berries and whipped cream. Unfortunately, the creme brulee was a bit disappointing as it didn't have a nice hard sugar topping. It tasted good, but there is nothing better than cracking into a nice crunchy sugar topping. All in all, I would highly recommend this restaurant if you are looking for a classic steakhouse experience.

RHqWcf5nUR7OMyc6OFow1w.text: I have a mostly vegetarian diet.  I eat vegetarian about 99% of the year.  I only make exceptions for when I travel out of the country or a special occasion.  Never had Kobe beef before, but I definitely don't feel bad for a cow that gets treated better than I do.  The meat was so tender and just melts in your mouth.  If I could afford this more often, I may eat it once in a while.    The service here was great.  Our waiter was really nice and made some good attempts to keep our table cheerful and satisfied.  I wish I could remember his name, but definitely hands down excellent service.    I would definitely revisit this place again.

seDanavR-StvhyUfE7l2LA.text: Great service + delicious food = repeat customer!  Came here for my belated birthday dinner and left happy! Ordered lobster Mac & Cheese, 34oz Bone-in porterhouse for two, salmon, and some drinks. Frankly speaking, nothing can beat Kobe beef I had in LA but I was satisfied with the porterhouse. Great service from runners to servers; customer service was top notch!  In addition, I enjoyed the food plating techniques as well!! Definitely coming back next time I visit sin city!

photos.caption: Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hmmmmmm.. steak...

Mys2-mtsAzD-qxxG32g49Q.text: It had some good aspects and some poor aspects. The venue is loud and smoky being situated in the casino walkway but you get to see lots of people.  The service was mixed. The woman taking care of drinks and bread was quite good. The waiter mixed up our order because he didn't write it down. I ordered a burger and asked not to have the foie gras butter but he forgot.  The French onion soup was good but not worth $17. The burger was bad. It didn't have much flavor and was cold and uncooked in the center. The fries were great.  The steak was tasty and well seared.  Overall I think Joe's Crab Shack and Steaks in the attached mall was much better all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brulee
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup

F4fDt0hDGiktHTU14kFR1Q.text: Went here with a group of 10 after being turned away at the Bacchanal Buffet. It was 8:30p and would likely have been seated right around closing. We opted to give this place a try since they could accommodate us right away.   The service was pretty a good, so low star rating reflects the food. Mind you, I'm only speaking for my wife and I, not the other 8 guests.   My wife had the Filet Mignon with creamed corn and I had the OH Burger.  She's not much of a steak aficionado but she was truly underwhelmed by her Filet Mignon. The high price raised expectations, and she felt truly let down.  She thought it was very dry.  The creamed corn was just okay.  I sampled that and thought, meh, not bad.    Now, the OH Burger was a complete train wreck. For $35, my expectations were EXTREMELY high. I was very disappointed, not only in the taste, but also in the presentation.  It was a greasy ass burger sitting on a white plate with some ketchup on the side.  What? It did NOT come with lettuce, tomatoes and onions. I had to ask for it. What?  $35?  What? The bun was EXTREMELY greasy. It literally fell apart after the first bite. I couldn't even finish the damn thing, it was so bad. I was yearning for an In-n-Out Burger!  Hell, I would have settled for Big Mac. Grass fed my ass!  If you're in Vegas and are looking for steak, you might want to consider elsewhere. If you want a burger...well you know how I felt about the burger.  One of our guests ordered the Sole, which looked awesome!  That's one to try if end up here.  Another guest ordered the scallops and thought they were too salty.  Two guests ordered the rib eye, which looked pretty good, so maybe that's worth a try as well.  I'm still disappointed we didn't get into the Bacchanal Buffet!

photos.caption: Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OH Burger.

nS06Z8aQCzIgrOA252STSA.text: Seriously one of the best rib-eye steaks I've ever had, and I'm not a steak person.  Baked potato was good sized and cooked to perfection.  Loved the little mini-trays of cheese, sour cream, bacon bits, etc to embellished as I please.  The Caesar Salad was excellent, but I think they were confused when we asked if they could add some chicken.  They basically sliced a chick breast on placed in on top of the salad.  It wasn't bad, just different I guess.  Only thing we did not like is where we were seated.  We were in a table to two a long the main route the servers pass with food making it a little noisy, but bearable.  The problem was when a couple sat at the table right above us on the next level a few inches higher with their backs to our table.  I could have probably given them a back rub from where I sat.  There server was so loud, and of course facing us, we couldn't have a conversation until he left.  Problem was, he came back a lot and was very chatty.  He was obviously having a good time with his guests, but we almost felt we were sitting with the help them couples back on one side and the servers continuously walking back and forth and the other.  However, dang that rib-eye was amazing!!  Pretty much makes up for everything I said above.  We'll be back during our next trip, will just ask for another place to sit.

I6OfqGXd0sBPGFTwH_-bKg.text: Made a reservation on Open Table and we were seated right away upon arrival.  There is a lot of staff so service was excellent.  My husband was creeped out cause the gal that would come around d to fill the water glasses would sneak up next to him without saying a word  it scared him every time.  The wine selection is nice.  The beet salad was good.  The steak was crusty and flavorful on the outside.  It was cooked unevenly however.  One half was medium like I ordered and the other half was more well done and a little tough.  The creamed spinach was very flavorful.  We ordered a sauce flight with our steak which didn't arrive with out steak.  Our waiter brought it later after we brought it to his attention.  It was taken off our bill which we appreciated.  Overall dinner was good and if staying at Caesar's Palace I would consider eating here again but I have had better in Vegas.

HgWu2Y7T0cwO8B8j2UmCyA.text: My husband and I came here cause we were really craving steak and this place was in our hotel (caesars). We didn't have to wait, even on a busy weekend...and the place was still crowded which is always a good sign.   Appetizers: We ordered the oysters Rockefeller, which I love...but these one's here had way too much sauce. I'm not an oyster fan, so sauce for me is a must...but they had just too much. Otherwise it was okay.  Dinner: I ordered the filet mignon, which came out perfect. I asked for medium well and it was cooked with just enough pink and very well seasoned so no complaints with the main dish. As a side my husband and I split the lobster mac and cheese. This is where I had my biggest issue. I love mac and cheese just as much as anybody else, especially when it's thick and cheesy...but this place served the most overly rich mac and cheese I've ever tasted. It was borderline sour how rich it was, and it was grossly creamy. I couldn't taste the lobster either. I'd pass on this, sadly.  Desert: We ordered the cookie with ice cream. It was okay, just a little too much caramel and chocolate sauce.  Overall, this place is good. The savior was the main course, which is what we came for in the first place. The sides could use some work though.

GaiMLg5xRj5WZ72d5s-6Bw.text: Summer Surf & Turf Special. French Onion Soup or Caesar Salad + 8oz Filet with a giant shrimp on a potato cake drenched in delicious scampi sauce. Finished with a berry compote covered Creme Brule. Everything was absolutely delicious. The service was friendly and attentive. I'd definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brulé
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet with scampi. Summer special.
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Summer Surf &amp; Turf Menu

90zeaR_cZI90IAZPnkNQQQ.text: Came here last month for the second time. Wow, it may not be as elegant as Prime over at Bellagio, but the service is one of a kind. You can mumble your words and they'll bring your drink in a few. They are very attentive it's almost like a dream. The food is good. Had the ribeye and the porterhouse. Didn't care for the porterhouse too much but the ribeye was excellent. Would definitely go again

photos.caption: Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R1AzOzALK6z4zVVieLSlQg.text: OHS. As recommended by a variety of folks as a great spot to get steak in Las Vegas. This place was excellent. Perfectly cooked and juicy steak, wonderful sides, and a pre dinner bread assortment that was for the gods (warm pretzel sticks????!!!) as I ate my meal the staff checked in periodically and brought me drinks and more bread, they then offered to pack me a to go assortment after I remarked how much I liked them. And I got an entire bag of rolls. What a great spot. Absolutely delicious steak!!

photos.caption: Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Med rare
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 16oz ribeye
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread

BQH7FAAB2LywKBMqPBDDog.text: Great steakhouse, classic Caesars style and the food is always on point and delicious! Cheesecake is the best I've had in town and I've eaten at most restaurants in the strip at this point.

LbN-UUOVO2J3b3hc0_pXlQ.text: Will I ever go here again? Only f you're paying for it. Slightly different than the one in NYC which disappointed me from the get go but I still decided to give it a shot. Rib Eye steak was over cooked to my liking and far from being worth the 82 bucks associated with it. Creamed Spinach was pretty good but like everything else, over priced. The fried calamari was OK but I've had better. My check including a soda was $133.  I was alone but the price didn't shock me. The steak for its size and quality can be beaten by Jerry's Nugget. Jerry's will hit you for 29 bucks for a far superior piece of meat. But the rent at Caesars along with the NYC name have to be paid for. So this is what you get. I won't be back unless you're paying for it. The waiter was a nice guy and that's why a two star got boosted to a three

photos.caption: Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Calamari was OK but far from the best I&#39;ve vet had
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamed Spinach was very good but not worth the price.
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak was ordered rare. This is not rare in my book

viFBdm5W_NzAYkvacxR7_w.text: I've been to Old Homestead in Atlantic City several times, so I was hoping that this location would be just as good,  and it was! We ordered a 16oz Ribeye, the 24 oz Bone In Ribeye, Duck Fat Fries, Cheesy potatoes Au Gratin, Asparagus. I requested everything be well seasoned, and they obliged.   The Duck Fat Fries left something to be desired, but everything else was delicious. I think the Potatoes could've been a bigger serving. I thought they cut the portion size. I don't eat alot, but trying to share for 3 ppl as suggested was not sufficient. I thought they would have come in the cast iron skillet like the Mac and Cheese etc.   The ambiance was nice, but I didn't care for a portion of the seating being opened up into the casino. It was a little loud my dreams and I had to practically yell to communicate. I miss the bread with craisins in it, it was my favorite. Overall great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half 16oz Ribeye, Cheesy Potatoes Au Gratin and Asparagus
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesy Potatoes Au Gratin

12c8i9G5Wb7N9FPF5hBmAg.text: Dinner celebration with friends was simply amazing from the moment we arrive the hostess was super friendly and professional the service was exceptional our server did gave recomendations to one of my friend with great results. The cocktails were amazing with a great attention to detail presentation. The food from the appetizers to the main course a True five star worth it. I had the fillet oscar and was incredible! Chocolate dessert was the perfect choice to close the perfect dining experience. Manager came to our table to check our experience with a great touch of class.   definitely will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fillet oscar

DL_ZxsXpOWwrkuOpTeEPPA.text: My experience was very underwhelming here.  I'll start with the good because there are some good things about our dinner.  It was our anniversary dinner and we noted that on our reservation.  The hostess and the waiter were both aware of our special occasion.  The waiter and his assistant were very attentive throughout our meal.  Service is probably a solid 4 to 4.5 stars.  The food is not special.  I completely understand that there is only so much you can do with a steak.  However, if am paying premium pricing to eat at steakhouse, I am expecting Mastros level of quality and presentation.  And giving the price, I want the restaurant to pay attention to the details. For example, the steak knife.  I want a blade that extends through the entire handle.  But more importantly, it MUST NOT be a serrated knife. What the hell?!?! This absolutely ruined my dining experience.  With that being said, the bone in ribeye was fine.  Cooked as ordered.  The sides were nothing to write home about. The portions for the sides are fairly small and just not that great.  Overall food score is a 3.  Although we did not intend on having dessert, the waiter surprised us with a complimentary creme brulee. This was a class move.  The creme brulee is a good one.  Worth paying for!    There are other great steak options in Vegas. Caesars could have done better on this.

photos.caption: Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Serrated steak knife. This is not Sizzlers!
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak knife with blade only extending through part of the handle

bDXGfbAeZjxMQokcKUPTHw.text: The night started out terribly , we first went to Ruth's Chris's in Harrahs and we were treated so badly by the Hostess and Manager that we had to leave. The hotel Manager recommended old homestead steakhouse in Ceasers palace. The food was amazing and the service was 5 star. The hostess and waiter were awesome, and the manager even came to the table to make sure everything was fantastic. The hostess even knew a lot about the history of the first NYC location, which was amazing. Ruth's Chris's loss was our gain. Thanks for a great night !  Gregory Leder

sj2Xl5dWZ06foDdQcj4hWg.text: It was our anniversary so we wanted to go to a nice steakhouse. The service was great but the steaks were under-whelming.  My wife and I both had the Summer Prix-Fixe Special.   The First Course was Caesar Salad or French Onion soup. We both had the salads and they were good.   The main course was an 8oz. Black Angus filet which included 1 large shrimp scampi, on top, and a potato cake underneath. My steak was just OK but my wife's was not cooked right and had to be sent back. The shrimp scampi was rather over cooked and tough. The "potato cake" was also not really very good. It was kind of tasteless and really tough which is hard to imagine.   The dessert course was Creme Brulee which was really the high-lite of the meal. It was one of the best we have ever had.

vFY6Zn35Qujh77r-aG2HuA.text: Everything was good but the super jumbo shrimp cocktail was a bit dry. My wagyu rib cap was amazing and the king crab legs was the best next to a fresh live one. Will be returning.  Oh, service was great too.

photos.caption: Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. On point
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesy
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfectly cooked NY

tjIUaEn4A6UsrQNrkm4cWA.text: Wow!!! Did not disappoint! As a Vegas local, we hardly ever make it to the Strip for dinner (even for special occasions) however, that will change because this place was outstanding and worth every penny.  We were sat at a booth where we could see the crowds of people walking by so it was nice to do a little bit of people watching while sipping our wine and relaxing. The service was nothing less than stellar; met and exceeded our expectations for the entire meal. Now the meal...THE MEAL....was amazing! We ordered way more food than we needed to because it all sounded so good. It was literally THE best steak that I have ever had.  Not to be outdone by the steak but do yourself a favor and get the chocolate cake for dessert...YOU'RE WELCOME!  Next time you are in Vegas or if you are local, try Old Homestead. It is a great spot for special occasions or if you just want a fabulous meal with great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Old Homestead Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beet Salad

lhxOH8KPywicJiCxPpB0QA.text: The food here was excellent....and I would recommend this beautiful restaurant to everyone..the ambience was wonderful; the staff was sooooo friendly.
